It was set by German freediver Tom Sietes in a rival with the former record holder Brazil, Ricardo Bocce. Both athletes settled in tanks of water and tried not to yield to each other in the duration of the breath hold. This time Sietes managed to hold underwater without air for 22 minutes and 22 seconds.
